00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 parserDifferenceQuotient.pl - An answer checker for difference quotients.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 This is a Parser class that implements an answer checker for
00024 difference quotients as a subclass of the Formula class.  The
00025 standard ->cmp routine will work for this.  The difference quotient
00026 is just a special type of formula with a special variable
00027 for 'dx'.  The checker will give an error message if the
00028 student's result contains a dx in the denominator, meaning it
00029 is not fully reduced.
00030 
00031 Use DifferenceQuotient(formula) to create a difference equation
00032 object.  If the context has more than one variable, the last one
00033 alphabetically is used to form the dx.  Otherwise, you can specify
00034 the variable used for dx as the second argument to
00035 DifferenceQuotient().  You could use a variable like h instead of
00036 dx if you prefer.
00037 
00038 =head1 USAGE
00039 
00040     $df = DifferenceQuotient("2x+dx");
00041     ANS($df->cmp);
00042 
00043     $df = DifferenceQuotient("2x+h","h");
00044     ANS($df->cmp);
00045 
00046     Context()->variables->are(t=>'Real',a=>'Real');
00047     ANS(DifferenceQuotient("-a/[t(t+dt)]","dt")->cmp);
00048 
00049 =cut
00050 
00051 loadMacros('MathObjects.pl');
00052 
00053 sub _parserDifferenceQuotient_init {DifferenceQuotient::Init()}; # don't reload this file
00054 
00055 package DifferenceQuotient;
00056 our @ISA = qw(Value::Formula);
00057 
00058 sub Init {
00059   main::Context("Numeric");  ### FIXME:  probably should require author to set this explicitly
00060   main::PG_restricted_eval('sub DifferenceQuotient {new DifferenceQuotient(@_)}');
00061 }
00062 
00063 sub new {
00064   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00065   my $current = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00066   my $formula = shift;
00067   my $dx = shift || $current->flag('diffQuotientVar') || 'd'.($current->variables->names)[-1];
00068   #
00069   #  Make a copy of the context to which we add a variable for 'dx'
00070   #
00071   my $context = $current->copy;
00072   $context->variables->add($dx=>'Real') unless ($context->variables->get($dx));
00073   $q = bless $context->Package("Formula")->new($context,$formula), $class;
00074   $q->{'dx'} = $dx;
00075   return $q;
00076 }
00077 
00078 sub cmp_class {'a Difference Quotient'}
00079 
00080 sub cmp_defaults{(
00081   shift->SUPER::cmp_defaults,
00082   ignoreInfinity => 0,
00083 )}
00084 
00085 sub cmp_postprocess {
00086   my $self = shift; my $ans = shift; my $dx = $self->{'dx'};
00087   return if $ans->{score} == 0 || $ans->{isPreview};
00088   $main::__student_value__ = $ans->{student_value};
00089   my ($value,$err) = main::PG_restricted_eval('$__student_value__->substitute(\''.$dx.'\'=>0)->reduce');
00090   $self->cmp_Error($ans,"It looks like you didn't finish simplifying your answer")
00091     if $err && $err =~ m/division by zero/i;
00092 }
00093 
00094 1;
